page.title: 15HOUSING IN YATTON
page.content: The older houses in Yatton are situated along the High Street.They are mainly constructed of the locally-quarried grey limestone.At the Horsecastle end of Yatton can be found many small terraced houses built for the workers in the former furniture factory.After the first World War a complete estate known as Wakedean Gardens was built by the factory owners, Wake and Dean.At the end of the 19th and beginning of 20th century several large houses were built by wealthy people between the village and the station. Immediately before and after the second World War more houses were built,for instance at Derhem Park ,but the major expansion of the village occurred in the sixties and seventies. More house may be built on the site of the furniture factory.
